title: [FEATURE] DeviceType Support for SKView Touch Events to support stylus
body:
SkiaSharp canvas view events always have touch device type even when touched with a pen.

SkCanvasView.OnTouch() events:
SKTouchEventArgs has a Touch device type which always registers as a “touch” event. on Android at

https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/b8511b732b77b6e9f3b4929a5fa5598d189adf1d/source/SkiaSharp.Views.Forms/SkiaSharp.Views.Forms.Android/SKTouchHandler.cs

The event is being created using the constructor that doesn’t have the device ID :

```
var args = new SKTouchEventArgs(id, SKTouchAction.Pressed, coords, true);
``` 

Which is then defaulting to touch:
 
```
public SKTouchEventArgs(long id, SKTouchAction type, SKPoint location, bool inContact)
    : this(id, type, SKMouseButton.Left, SKTouchDeviceType.Touch, location, inContact, 0)
{
}
```

**Describe the solution you'd like**
in the SkTouchHandler.OnTouch, set the SkTouchEventArgs DeviceType based on the MotionEvent device type.
You can find the type under the motionevent property of the args then calling GetToolType on it 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/android.views.motionevent.gettooltype?view=xamarin-android-sdk-9#Android_Views_MotionEvent_GetToolType_System_Int32_

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
none found

**Additional context**
none
